name: Sachse Muslim Society
mission: Sachse Muslim Society (SMS) is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that was established in 2014. We are dedicated to religious education and community service. SMS serves Sachse, Wylie, Rowlett, North Garland, Rockwall, and Murphy communities.
theoryOfChange: By providing structured Quranic education and a physical masjid space, the organization aims to revive hearts and nurture the spiritual and intellectual growth of the next generation of Muslims.
zakatClaimEvidence: Found 'zakat al-fitr' on https://sachsemasjid.org/ (https://sachsemasjid.org/); Website mission/programs mention zakat

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Limited match due to weaker results and/or higher uncertainty; review methodology details before deciding.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: fi_sabilillah (+5); Humanitarian service (+2)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 25/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish a time-bound plan to deploy excess unrestricted reserves into mission delivery, while keeping a clear operating reserve floor.
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes over at least 3 years.

risks.risk_summary: Key concern: Program expense ratio critically low: 14%

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Sachse Muslim Society shows moderate alignment and limited impact, with zakat compliance (significant risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Found 'zakat al-fitr' on https://sachsemasjid.org/ (https://sachsemasjid.org/); Website mission/programs mention zakat

all_citations.claim: The organization was established for religious education and community service, operating the Sachse Quran Academy and Hifdh programs.
The organization is zakat-eligible and provides various methods for religious giving.
The organization engages the community through volunteer opportunities, particularly during Ramadan.
The organization reported total revenue of $2,799,757 and a program expense ratio of 13.6%.
Financial data indicates the organization holds 63.0 months of working capital and a fundraising efficiency of $0.11 per $1 raised.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization receives a score of 33/100, reflecting a balance between its strong financial reserves and fundraising efficiency against a low program expense ratio and limited transparency regarding impact data.
areas_for_improvement: Low program expense ratio of 13.6%, suggesting a high proportion of revenue is held in reserve or directed toward non-programmatic costs
Limited public documentation regarding specific impact metrics and outcome tracking
Low data confidence score due to limited third-party verification of program effectiveness

dimension_explanations.alignment: The alignment score of 25/50 represents a medium level of donor fit, as the organization serves a high-urgency religious and cultural cause for Muslim donors [1]. It offers clear avenues for religious giving, including zakat-eligible donations and volunteer opportunities during Ramadan [2][3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization's impact score of 14/50 is considered low, as it primarily focuses on direct service provision without providing extensive third-party evidence of long-term outcomes [1][5]. While it maintains a significant total revenue of $2,799,757, the program expense ratio is 13.6%, indicating that a smaller portion of annual funds is currently deployed directly into active programming [4].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Sachse Muslim Society is a community-focused religious organization in Texas dedicated to Quranic education and local service.
strengths: High liquidity with 63.0 months of working capital available to sustain operations
Strong fundraising efficiency, spending only $0.11 to raise every $1
Direct provision of religious and educational services to the local community
baseline_narrative.summary: founded in 2014, the Sachse Muslim Society provides religious education and community services to Sachse and its surrounding areas [1]. The organization is recognized as zakat-eligible and operates the Sachse Quran Academy, which features specialized programs including Full Time Hifdh and Part Time Hifz [1][2].
